title: Issue with DJ Sona Voiceover (very hard to understand with additional VO filtering)

embed.description: Voice for the new Ultimate Skin DJ Sona

body:
First and foremost, this skin looks freaking bananas.. incredibly good job to your art and modeling department, much deserved kudos to all of you.

That being said, I have to admit that I'm less than impressed with the new voiceover.  There's so much distortion and reverb that it's incredibly hard to hear what she's saying at all.  I like the idea of adding an 'electronic' edge to her voice for this skin, but you guys have to seriously tone back on the distortion/reverb, or it's just gonna sound like a really big echo'y mess.  I've included a YouTube link to the new voiceover so you can listen to it and draw your own conclusions.

You guys have a *really* good product here, and my wife and I will be insta-buying it as soon as it drops, but please, consider doing something with the voiceover.

The only other minor pet peeve I have is not being able to select which song I want to listen to when she's on my team, but that's relatively minor considering how overbearing the VO issue is.

Regards,

Tech

replies.body:
Hey guys,

I just wanted to jump in and comment on this. We intended for her VO to not be understandable. This VO change was made in order for the VO to not distract or interfere with her music. She has an obvious Daft punk/EDM feel and we wanted the VO to harmonize with that.  

The VO is also supposed to be heard with her music. I would hold off on final judgement until you get the whole experience. :D

http://youtubedoubler.com/?video1=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DJgaxVzYurPI&start1=1&video2=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DTny2nx9kz0g&start2=3&authorName=DJ+Sona

Long URL is long, but if anyone was interested in hearing how her VO sounded with the music, I'm guessing it'll be something like this.

Oh yeah this is very very close to what you get in game! One small difference is that the VO will not play as often as it does in the VO preview.  We have scripts in place that staggers the VO. So Vo can only be triggered after a rest period, this is how VO works on all champions. :D

I'm not going to tell you how to do your job..... But please, at least consider the possibility of allowing players to enable and disable the voice at their leisure. This voice is a massive turn off for a fair amount of people, including myself. It would be a godsend if it could be disabled so that the music can be enjoyed to its fullest potential.
You can actually do this already! You just need to can go into your sound settings (while in game) and set voice volume to zero. This way you hear no VO at all. :D
Agree with Derpy Mike, if her voice is more understandable it will be great, clear talking and energetic music are perfect combination . Btw the style of her VO is way different from Daft Punk/ EDMs'

I agree with that statement. There's a way her voice could be understandable while not being too wildly different from the music. As it is now, it's like breaking the music with random noise. It would be perfect if they were in sync with the music, but they're not.

That being said, Shad's  preview make it sound a lot better than just the lone VO.

Would it even be possible to sync it with the music though? I thought VO was triggered by your character doing an action... using an ability or moving... so if she was moving from point to point and saying something it either would be out of sync with the music or out of sync with the movement... I kinda prefer it to be in sync with the action..
I'd presonally see it easier and better to put it in sync with actions (no new code). But make it less noisy and more like lyrics.

Yes, I could. But Having to turn it on or off every time I wanted to / not to play her would gett annoying very quickly. Additionally I'd miss out on every other voice in the match, most of which I don't have a problem with. How am I meant to appreciate the enemy Jinx /L-ing at me. Or how will I know if {{champion:14}} ***THIS IS WHAT PASSES FOR WARRRRRRRRRR!!???!!***
Dude at this point you are just arguing for the sake of arguing lol

I know right. How dare I have a different opinion to the drones, bootlickers, and shills. I *must* be doing it for the sake of arguing.

It's definitely not because I want this skin to be worth the asking price of thirty dollars. The fact that significantly cheaper skins have more and tangible dialog than this skin right now deeply saddens me and I want to see it fixed.

My overall hostility stems from fear, friend. Regardless of whether or not it's good, bad, or even tangible, 3 minutes of dialogue is inexcusable for a thirty dollar skin. If we let this shit fly now, what's stopping riot from lowering the bar even further on their next ultimate skin release? People are buying into their cop-outs and the fact that riot can do-no-wrong in their eyes ***seriously*** worries me.

> [{quoted}](name=Neo Cyrus,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=ELgn5vMa,comment-id=000f0001,timestamp=2015-02-03T21:36:19.601+0000)
>

Because the purpose of this skin in particular is not to have lots of lines.

This one's purpose is to have lots of music.

Spirit Guard Udyr's was to highlight his multiform capabilities, and Pulsefire Ezreal was to emphasize his egotistical super future grandstanding.

So, naturally, Sona is going to be purely about the music.

I don't understand this thinking.

I love the idea of the skin. I love the particles, the icons, and the music, but the way the VO is being handled leaves a sour taste in my mouth. Riot, you've set [your own rules](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752874-Guide-to-Skin-Price-Tiers) as to what you have to deliver to justify a skin costing around $25 when not on sale: so, deliver.

Riot has clearly listed the criteria for an ultimate skin, including "new voice over and sounds." Okay, we've got the new sounds. Plenty of them. Over 3 hours. Now where's the new voice over? If the idea is that overcompensating in one area is supposed to cover for a lack of development in the other then I don't agree.

And I don't agree that the remixing and filtering of an old voice over into electronic gibberish to disguise the fact that it's recycled constitutes a new voice over. In my opinion, it seems lazy and cheap, like they didn't want to hire a voice actor or singer. It feels to me like it wasn't a stylistic decision but a sneaky one to disguise a shortcut taken.

And I don't understand why you're okay with it, or why you're saying it's because the skin is all about the music. The human voice is music. It's the original instrument. It doesn't need to be rendered unintelligible to be musical. A similar effect can be achieved with real, honest to goodness, understandable words from a brand spanking new VO put through the same process. And everyone can be happy and everything can be square. But I don't see that happening. And that makes me a little sad.

EDIT: Apparently some [new lines were recorded.](https://twitter.com/ErinFitzgerald/status/562689192153853954) This only bothers me more. They had the voice actress in the studio and recorded new lines, but you can hardly tell because of the processing and remixing with the old lines. They had the opportunity to do a proper, full, new VO but went this route instead. Disappointing.

That's one of the dumbest excuses I've ever heard. Not only does it not have "lots of music", it doesn't have lots of anything. I just tried it now. It's annoying hearing gibberish, as if I really needed to play it to confirm.

Guys, guys, guys, I think some of us are forgetting, even though this is mentioned below IN this thread. Sona doesn't speak. It shouldn't even be called a VO technically, more of a TO (Thought-Over) I'll quote what Cirrusstrafe posted here.

> Now you're getting it!
> 
> Remember, Sona is mute. She can only "communicate" with her summoner through a mental link.
> 
> So... if all she's doing is thinking about and jamming out to music, then it stands to reason that her thoughts would be influenced as such. Heck, one can go so far as to say that her thoughts are only music, and now that she's in the groove she isn't trying so hard to make them conform to our limited human vocals.

Unfortunately final judgement is way to late for changes. Final judgement is after it goes live, and I don't want to see the backlash when people realize that Sona has illegible lines on a $30 skin. It's okay if the lines are hard to hear, but to make them complete gibberish?

Daft Punk - Instant Crush is a good song to model the voice after. You can clearly hear words being spoken in English, yet you can still misinterpret words.


All I got from DJ Sona's voice with music was "They want fire?" "A league of your life" "Give yourself a baby" "let me smile". I mean... I know I'm wrong on all accounts too.


Listen to Spirit Guard Udyr. "Tough as the turtle!" "United as one!" "Life.. speaks through US!" "Who would stand against us?" "We are filled with might!"

Pulsefire Ezreal: "All charged up." "-Pulsefire systems online- Let's do this." "Grim-dark future, huh? Too easy." "-Ezreal, do you require a map?- No."

Those voices have power behind them. You buy that ultimate skin it feels like an ultimate skin. From the voice to the tiniest of effects. Sona does not have the voice, only the effects; Musical and particle.
